Local mode: User provides own Claude API key (bypasses platform)
Local mode: No usage tracking, full privacy
File path support (single file or directory)
Batch processing with glob patterns
Configuration file support (.codescriberc)
Cross-platform support (Windows, macOS, Linux)
npm package publication
CI/CD integration (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins)

Natural language interface ('document this repo')

High complexity → Claude or Gemini 3.0 (Claude: 77.2% SWE-bench, Gemini 3.0: 76.2%)
Structured output docs (JSDOC, OPENAPI) → GPT-5.1 or Gemini 3.0 (both have structured output APIs)

Configurable complexity thresholds per tier
Real-time cost estimation based on routing decision
Analytics: routing decisions vs quality scores
User override: force specific model regardless of complexity
Learning system: adjust routing based on quality feedback
